pullRequest.body:
We prove the following result:

> Let `s` be a bounded, measurable set of `Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñù` whose frontier has zero volume and let `F` be a 
> continuous function. Then the limit as `n ‚Üí ‚àû` of `‚àë F x / n ^ card Œπ`, where the sum is over the
> points in `s ‚à© n‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ (Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñ§)`, tends to the integral of `F` over `s`.

using Riemann integration. As a special case, we deduce that 

> The limit as `n ‚Üí ‚àû` of `card (s ‚à© n‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ (Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñ§)) / n ^ card Œπ` tends to the volume of `s`.

Both of these statements are for a variable `n : ‚Ñï`. However, with the additional hypothesis: 
`x ‚Ä¢ s ‚äÜ y ‚Ä¢ s` whenever `0 < x ‚â§ y`, we generalize the previous statement to a real variable. 

This PR is part of the proof of the Analytic Class Number Formula.

---

-->

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

bors d+

```suggestion
    Set.Finite (s ‚à© span ‚Ñ§ (Set.range b)) := by
```
The parens are not necessary here.

```suggestion
  have : DiscreteTopology (span ‚Ñ§ (Set.range b)) := inferInstance
```

```suggestion
  infer_instance
```

Doesn't this just say `index n x ‚àà admissibleIndex n B` (which is `mem_admissibleIndex_of_mem_box n hB hx`)? Why this more convoluted statement?
(I guess the actual question is, can this not easily be inlined where it is used?)
Indeed, it can be easily inlined at the only place it is used.
Is this the standard lattice (like ‚Ñ§‚Åø ‚äÜ ‚Ñù‚Åø)? It would perhaps be good to add a docstring.

```suggestion
    c ‚Ä¢ span ‚Ñ§ (Set.range b) = span ‚Ñ§ (Set.range (b.isUnitSMul (fun _ ‚Ü¶ hc.isUnit))) := by
```
if you like...

```suggestion
  rw [ZSpan.smul _ (inv_ne_zero (NeZero.ne _)), Basis.mem_span_iff_repr_mem]
```
works here (`NeZero (n : ‚Ñù)` is deduced automatically from `NeZero n`).

Maybe have a general lemma
```lean
lemma mem_smul_span_iff (v : Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñù) : v ‚àà (n : ‚Ñù)‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ L ‚Üî ‚àÄ i, n * v i ‚àà Set.range ‚áë(algebraMap ‚Ñ§ ‚Ñù)
```
and use it here and below?
Yes, that's a good idea.

```suggestion
    integralSum (Set.indicator s F) (BoxAdditiveMap.toSMul (Measure.toBoxAdditive volume))
```
The namespace `BoxIntegral` is open here. (You can also remove `BoxIntegral.` in the `unfold` line below.)

```suggestion
    rw [‚Üê coe_pointwise_smul, ZSpan.smul _ (inv_ne_zero (NeZero.ne _))]
```
(compare above)

```suggestion
    exact ZSpan.setFinite_inter _ (B.isBounded.subset hs‚ÇÄ)
```

```suggestion
    rw [volume_box, prepartition_tag n (mem_admissibleIndex_of_mem_box n hB (hs‚ÇÄ hx.1)),
```

```suggestion
theorem _root_.tendsto_tsum_div_pow_atTop_integral (hF : Continuous F) (hs‚ÇÅ : IsBounded s)
```
`Bornology` is open (also below).

```suggestion
    obtain ‚ü®C‚ÇÄ, h‚ÇÄ‚ü© := (Box.isCompact_Icc B).exists_bound_of_continuousOn hF.continuousOn
```
if you like...

```suggestion
    rw [Set.indicator]
    split_ifs with hs
    ¬∑ exact le_max_of_le_right (h‚ÇÄ x hx)
    ¬∑ exact norm_zero.trans_le <|le_max_left 0 _
```
`split_ifs` tends to lead to slightly nicer proofs in these situations.

```suggestion
      using hF.continuousOn.continuousAt_indicator h
```
dot notation again

```suggestion
  ‚ü®Nat.ne_zero_iff_zero_lt.mpr <| (Nat.ceil_pos.mpr (inv_pos.mpr (r 0 0).prop)).trans_le hn‚ü©
```
is an alternative.

```suggestion
special case of `tendsto_card_div_pow` with `F = 1`. -/
```

```suggestion
  rw [Nat.card_congr (tendsto_card_div_pow‚ÇÅ s hx.ne'),
      Nat.card_congr (tendsto_card_div_pow‚ÇÅ s (hx.trans_le hy).ne')]
```

```suggestion
  ¬∑ exact Set.inter_subset_inter_left _ <| hs‚ÇÑ hx hy
```

```suggestion
    (Nat.floor_le (zero_le_one.trans hx))
```

```suggestion
  filter_upwards [eventually_gt_atTop 0] with x hx
  gcongr
  exact tendsto_card_div_pow‚ÇÇ s hs‚ÇÅ hs‚ÇÑ hx (Nat.le_ceil _)
```

```suggestion
      =·∂†[atTop] (fun x ‚Ü¶ (Nat.card ‚Üë(s ‚à© (‚åäx‚åã‚Çä : ‚Ñù)‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ L) : ‚Ñù) / x ^ card Œπ) := by
```
(two spaces extra indentation)

```suggestion
  rw [div_pow, mul_div, div_mul_cancel‚ÇÄ _ (by positivity)]
```
This saves quite a lot of heatbeats.

```suggestion
  rw [div_pow, mul_div, div_mul_cancel‚ÇÄ _ (by positivity)]
```

```suggestion
/-- A version of `tendsto_card_div_pow_atTop_volume` for a real variable. -/
```

```suggestion
  rw [show (volume s).toReal = (volume s).toReal * 1 ^ card Œπ by ring]
  refine tendsto_of_tendsto_of_tendsto_of_le_of_le' ?_ ?_
    (tendsto_card_div_pow‚ÇÉ s hs‚ÇÅ hs‚ÇÑ) (tendsto_card_div_pow‚ÇÑ s hs‚ÇÅ hs‚ÇÑ)
  ¬∑ refine Tendsto.congr' (tendsto_card_div_pow‚ÇÖ s) (Tendsto.mul ?_ (Tendsto.pow ?_ _))
    ¬∑ exact Tendsto.comp (tendsto_card_div_pow_atTop_volume s hs‚ÇÅ hs‚ÇÇ hs‚ÇÉ) tendsto_nat_floor_atTop
    ¬∑ exact tendsto_nat_floor_div_atTop
  ¬∑ refine Tendsto.congr' (tendsto_card_div_pow‚ÇÜ s) (Tendsto.mul ?_ (Tendsto.pow ?_ _))
```
Can move this up, as it's used in both branches.
Good point

```suggestion
  rw [‚Üê Set.mem_compl_iff, compl_frontier_eq_union_interior] at hx
```

```suggestion
  unfold integralSum
```
I think `eq_of_mem_smul_span_of_index_eq_index` would be a better name (there is no "and" in the assumptions, and the order of assumptions is different than in the current name).

```suggestion
    ‚Üë(s ‚à© c‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ L) ‚âÉ ‚Üë(c ‚Ä¢ s ‚à© L) :=
```

source.title: feat (Lattice/Covolume): Add results linking point counting in lattices and covolume
